paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the BRCA2 gene variant Tyr42Cys, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.phenotype_details: predisposes women to early onset breast cancer
individual_records.evidence_sentence: a Tyr42Cys mutation in BRCA2 inhibits the interaction of BRCA2 with replication protein A, a protein essential for DNA repair, replication and recombination.

functional_data.summary: The mutation inhibits the interaction of BRCA2 with replication protein A, affecting DNA repair mechanisms.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation is associated with early onset breast cancer in the affected individual.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation is linked to a significant disruption in protein function.
key_quotes: Lack of this interaction inhibits the recruitment of double stranded break repair proteins and eventually leads to an accumulation of carcinogenic DNA changes.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the relevant variant was clearly described in the text.
